sub_title: Change & Strategy | Playing with Building Blocks of Identity, Interaction & Education
summary:
Like a curious, some may say annoying,  three-year-old, my work is built upon asking ‘Why (not)’ to break new ground and open up space for ‘What-ever’ to flourish. Renowned for my polymath mindset and enthusiasm, I turn worlds upside down, shake up beliefs, reveal naked truths, and strip down ideas to its core, without losing sight of one’s identity, ambition, potential, and environment. Resulting in an intriguing track record of innovative strategies, interdisciplinary collaborations, experimental frameworks and forecast narratives that guide growth and bring values, ideas, goals, stories, and people together. Expect a not-your-everyday yet invigorating rollercoaster ride towards change, (social) innovation and collaboration. 

With more than a decade of experience in change strategy, cultural communications and interdisciplinary development - while also exploring the fascinating worlds of cognitive science, linguistics, philosophy and international education - I developed LiveWired, a life-oriented, 5D-thinking framework that aims to interact with change instead of (only) manage it.

projects.title: MINDFASHION.today
projects.description:
Within this complex and transforming fashion world, Janne Baetsen presents MIND FASHION: a unique voice & holistic [un]Framework for Fashion that focuses on human innovation by connecting different minds in - among others - Design, Psychology, Cultural Economics, Philosophy, History, Technology and Communications. 

With MIND FASHION Janne challenges boundaries and provides a refreshing voice and holistic lens to look at today's fashion industry, generating a deep understanding of the human nature and nurture of fashion and its effect on the world. Janne's objective is to educate others to understand the role of humans in fashion consumption, design, production and disposal. And with this, transforming today’s fashion industry attitudes and issues such as consumer behaviour, body image, environment, health, self-esteem, diversity and creativity, into ones that are environmentally conscious and mindful of social issues. 

Janne Baetsen: "I believe that to engage with today's issues we need to address the way we think, behave and communicate. Although sustainability, transparency and circular economy are important ‘hot’ topics, I want to go beyond  'labels' and look at them from a holistic perspective. Together with the industry, fashion experts, designers and other (fashion) minded specialists I want to address, analyse, challenge and predict the many questions discussed in today’s society and fashion industry to contribute to a better world. Focussing not only on clothing, trends and styles but also on the complexity of human behaviour, innovation and progress across all aspects of fashion."

contributors.headline: Change & Strategy | Playing with Building Blocks of Identity, Interaction & Education

projects.title: Fashion Makes Sense
projects.description:
Fashion matters, to our economy, to society, to art & creativity, and to each of us personally. Fashion is, besides a billion-dollar industry, the most immediate and intimate form of self-expression. BUT, it has its dark side: environmental impact, exploitation of workers, and impact on self-image. Fashion faces severe global environmental and social challenges, which will only be increasing.

Janne developed a plan for FASHIONCLASH to develop ‘Fashion Makes Sense’ in collaboration with the Province of Limburg.

AIM: to engage in a dialogue with the audience (consumer-designer-industry-education), with the believe that no change will be possible without interaction with the public. What we wear reflects on how we view the world and how we want the world to see us. Therefore, Janne wanted to inspire and encourage through the subject of fashion the public and the fashion industry to improve insight and engages on the topic sustainability. How? By starting to make the connection between what we (need to) value and what we wear and by re-establishing the connection between creator and consumer.

contributors.headline: Change & Strategy | Playing with Building Blocks of Identity, Interaction & Education

projects.title: FabricAge
projects.description:
FabricAge is a new unique fabric design label which emphasises on the active participation of the elderly and traditional crafts, bringing together the arts and crafts of textile design with the tangible and intangible heritage of our culture. FabricAge will facilitate communities of all ages to come together, to connect through creativity, to gain meaning and to become visible to society. The label will develop high-end one-of-a-kind textile designs, based on the wishes and preferences of clients, visualised by talented designers, crafted by experts, and collectively created by the senior community. Each design and process will be tailor-made, giving participants the opportunity to be part of a challenging, educational, social and creative experience, and enabling them to contribute to a unique design. This can range from an outspoken textile art object to an eye-catching wall decor.

Janne was responsible for the creation of the brand 'FabricAge' as well as contributing to the marketing & business strategy of the social enterprise.

contributors.headline: Change & Strategy | Playing with Building Blocks of Identity, Interaction & Education

projects.title: Museumnacht Maastricht
projects.description:
I have been part of Museumnacht Maastricht since the first edition in 2016. I am responsible for the overall organisation, creative concept development, tone of voice & marketing communication in collaboration with the participating art venues.

Museumnacht Maastricht has developed into quite the night, a night in which Maastricht goes above and beyond everyone's imagination! Over more than 4,000 art lovers enjoy a mind blowing Art meets Clubbing programme that takes over the city. There is something for everyone, young and old, Maastricht party people and worldly art wanderers, hard-core Museum Night fans and newcomers. Between 8:00 PM and 1:00 AM people can enjoy experimental art, intoxicating dreams, in-your-face performances, mesmerising music, historical artefacts, stunning collections, exclusive workshops, tours and artists’ talks, striking archaeological finds, cutting edge video art and energising drinks, bites & beats at various art venues spread across the city.

contributors.headline: Change & Strategy | Playing with Building Blocks of Identity, Interaction & Education

projects.title: Pick my Brain
projects.description: My love for creativity is strong. Therefore, my aim in life is to support (pro bono) upcoming artists and creative start-ups, and to allow their work and business to flourish. How? By helping them with marketing communications, by connecting them with relevant partners and an empowering network, or by being a challenging business partner. Projects: such as Design Day, Refuse Magazine, FASHIONCLASH, Bureau Europa, Marres, La Bergere Group, MiniBib, DocFest, The Big Draw Maastricht and many more. One of my favourites has to be photographer Sem Shayne (graduate MAFAD 2016) with his project CALAISFORNIA, the European Dream, in which he shows the absurd situation of both worlds meeting each other in Calais, France.

contributors.headline: Change & Strategy | Playing with Building Blocks of Identity, Interaction & Education

projects.title: FASHIONCLASH
projects.description:
Since 2010 and with a full-time focus in 2016 & 2017 I have as a (behind-the-scenes) Marketing, Brand & Business Development strategist for /with/ as part of FASHIONCLASH: 
•	· Addressed social issues in fashion and society (among others development plan Fashion Makes Sense for Provincie Limburg), proactively contributing to the well-being creative industry roles and delivering effective support to young designers to aid their entrepreneurial and knowledge development. 
•	Executed innovative marketing events and projects designed to drive engagement with a broad audience and maximise revenue potential 
•	Contributed to projects enabling young designers to develop, show and sell their work and become part of a greater network through organising events to challenge fashion and wider society 
•	· Supported the development and positioning of the business (specifically their future role) with a distinctive identity in the international media/fashion industry 
•	Connected the business with the city of Maastricht, sponsors and partners to deliver growth, supporting them to transform from a fashion festival into an influential fashion statement and renowned international platform for new talent

contributors.headline: Change & Strategy | Playing with Building Blocks of Identity, Interaction & Education

projects.title: Fashion House Maastricht
projects.description:
Fashion House Maastricht is a unique fashion incubator and a creative business accelerator, that contributes to an ecosystem that empowers the design-maker, fashion industry and (creative) economy. A knowledge centre that educates and helps upcoming designers to develop into successful creative entrepreneurs and professionals to reach their full potential. A platform that not only promotes a new generation of fashion designers but also guides and supports their transition into entrepreneurship. 
FASHIONCLASH is responsible for day-to-day organisation since August 2017.

Key achievements
•	Co-developed the foundation of Fashion House Maastricht, providing a platform to connect fashion and creativity to business and entrepreneurial development by bringing industry practices to fashion designers, following a new vision for design, production, retail, and education
•	Developing a space for the collaboration of many aspects of the Dutch fashion chain and managing all project phases 
•	Liaising with partners, experts and mentors to form a robust professional network to empower the design-maker and fashion industry in a creative economy
•	Establishing collaborations with partners and experts in the business, fashion and design industry to create a solid ecosystem for co-creation & synergie of funding.  
•	Creating the foundation for the future Fashion House Maastricht Business Development Program to teach new designers about key areas of the fashion business and skills on marketing, production, pricing along with bespoke business plan guidance 
•	Attracting substantial PR and attention from media and the fashion industry (to launch the concept) through the creation, development and implementation of an effective branding and marketing strategy

contributors.headline: Change & Strategy | Playing with Building Blocks of Identity, Interaction & Education

projects.title: Collaborative Unit Project, UAL, London College of Fashion
projects.description:
Driven by my fascination for human nature in the context of (fashion) design, I challenged the minds and creativity of students of the University of the Arts London (UAL), London College of Fashion as part of the Collaborative Unit.  Caroline Zaidan, Isabelle Violet Thibault, Susanne James and Eleftheria Karipid  researched the engagement between fashion and the body/senses and engaged with the public on the issue: How can fashion nowadays truly connect with the body and human beings instead of being just a simple aesthetic of a symbolic phenomenon? 

Since fashion is such a multifaceted concept, the ways each of us understands it is quite varied, yet very relevant to the way in which we engage with the industry and the idea of fashion as a focus of study. In the zine that Isabelle, Caroline, Eleftheria and Susanne developed, they explore fashion and its relation to the senses, the psychological concept of enclothed cognition, and the ever-current issue of fashion and the body.  They will also be looking at two innovative Dutch designers who embody the theme of ‘Fashion Makes Sense’ with their unique approaches to design. With three psychology students and one journalism student, they put their minds and experiences with fashion together to form a review that explores each concept textually and visually; examining the beautiful and ugly sides of a fascinating industry.

contributors.headline: Change & Strategy | Playing with Building Blocks of Identity, Interaction & Education

projects.title: The Flavours of Harrow: Taste the good life!
projects.description:
The Council of Harrow approached me to help them with the brand development of Harrow. Instead of delivering a campaign to attract new restaurants to Harrow, as was requested by them, I advised them to invest in positioning Harrow as a vibrant hotspot for food, drink and gastronomy,  a desirable destination and an attractive place to live, work and invest. To develop a brand that will help target investors to encourage more, better quality, food and drink venues. At the same time, it will work to shift the perceptions and behaviours of locals, with a focus on health, wellbeing and satisfaction.

I advised them to: 
- Develope a wider strategy concentrating on the four key areas: awareness, investment, health, and pay. 
- Create an evocative destination marketing campaign around gastronomy aimed at both a local and regional audience. 
- Focus this campaign further, adding depth and specific details, to increase food investment in the borough. 
- Encourage healthier behaviours and food options by targeting both brand and investment on, and perhaps even incentivising, healthier choices. Similarly, use the campaign to explore the benefits – both local and business – of fair pay. 

This wider project could make Harrow the first borough and council of London to successfully develop a stand-out community branding strategy that strengthens its distinctive identity.

contributors.headline: Change & Strategy | Playing with Building Blocks of Identity, Interaction & Education

projects.title: Maastricht Made: m2 city of creativity
projects.description:
In order to develop a new business strategy for Zuiderlucht I created a marketing community concept for Made in Maastricht; targeting the communities "Collaborations (stakeholders & initiatives), "Consumers & Customers, Citizens, Companies and Creative Minds" and following the process of "Connect - Collaborate, Communicate & Create ∞". 

With the "Maastricht Made" concept I present more than just a label or name to empower Maastricht as city of creativity. The plan focusses on a distinctive brand that will bring people together with an enduring and shared vision, that not only strengthens the brand but builds community, culture and contributes to the creative economy.  It's based on my believes that the perception of a place can be changed by revealing what is already there. The concept will bring out the best in communities and empower them to be better. How? By telling stories, sharing pictures, revealing locations, showing faces and supporting it with figures and results.

profile_positions.title: Strategist, Cultural Marketing and Project Development Expert

profile_positions.description:
- Building a distinctive identity and strong ecosystem for the city and (Eu)region and creating unity by acting as the interface between government and its citizens – in de broadest sense of the word. 
- Presenting the city as a home while instilling pride as a cultural destination and innovative business/knowledge center in line with its (future) potential.
- Acquiring an in-depth knowledge of communities’ feelings and perspectives on Maastricht and using this to help guide and nurture the city’s identity allowing the city and its citizens to stand out and grow collectively as part of a local, national and global ecosystem.
- Forging robust international collaborations to strengthen the city and the (Eu)region’s narrative of proud citizens, tourism and business growth including collaborating with local government, high-profile stakeholders, media partners, agencies, and communities to develop over 100 projects, 150 cultural events and 40 co-creation concepts.
- Strengthening the culture and creative industry and linking it to education and the economy to position Maastricht as an interdisciplinary capital of creativity as part of a multi-year strategy.
- Additionally, generated significant interest in Maastricht as a hub for designers and the wider creative industry with multiple international magazines publicising Maastricht as a City of Creativity & Fashion. 
- Launched the first dining experience in Maastricht through forming collaborations between competitors and grew the event from one restaurant week with 10 participants to a Maastricht Wine & Dine and taste Hospitality Experience with over 50 participants, tastemakers, bars and hotels generating circa €225k
